subject: PEL: Deleted PELs moved to new folder under logs
commitMessage:
PEL: Deleted PELs moved to new folder under logs

 - PELs whose corresponding event logs have been deleted
   will be available in the archive folder.
 - Archive folder size is tracked under sizeWarning() function.
 - Archived PELs log can be viewed using peltool with flag --archive.
 - PELs deleted using peltool is not archived.
 - Updated README.md

Change-Id: Ie2c1b4c2ca30fb79904bc9d582a01ef8102aed0e
Signed-off-by: Sumit Kumar <sumit_kumar@in.ibm.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 1d8835bbc52fe7077bef8d079cdb5df47d52abbf by Matt Spinler

I think you could fairly easily make a testcase for this that checks for the file to get moved into the archive subdir.  The 'repoPath' global in repository_test.cpp will give you the base path to the repo, so you can use that to find the archive dir.
ok
as I mentioned in the header, you can set this in the constructor.
yeah ok

none of this code would need to run if the PEL file isn't there, so you could do:

if pel file exists:
   create directory if necessary
   auto fileName = _archivePath / pel->second.path.filename()
   rename
yeah right. will structure accordingly.
I don't think this function is used?
yeah not yet. I put this function as may be needed later. Will remove if no use case.

maybe just 'archivePath'.  I always think of architecture when I see arch for some reason.

Also, you can just initialize this in the constructor like _logPath is, and then make it const.
ok will do
why did you add this?

Else 'archive' folder wasn't getting deleted. Following error reported if "-rf" not used:
../test/openpower-pels/pel_manager_test.cpp:820: Failure
Expected equality of these values:
  rc
    Which is: 256
  0
[  FAILED  ] ManagerTest.TestPELManualDeleteAll (637 ms)

Oh, right.  We probably don't want to delete the archive dir here, so how about:
    rm logPath.string() + "/*_*"
to just get the PEL files
Ok
Will remove this
this is already a fs::path, so you don't really need to wrap it in fs::path( )
yeah ok

I'm a little worried about having to do this on thousands of archived PELs every time this is called when adding/creating a new PEL in case it is slow.

I think I would feel better if we got some performance numbers how long this takes for a few thousand PELs, using the std::chrono functions for measurement.  Can create them just by putting 'busctl call ... Logging.Create... ' in a loop in a shell script.

There a few examples out in other BMC code on how to get durations.  One of them I found is https://grok.openbmc.org/xref/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/pid/zone.cpp?r=55ccad65#315

Yeah ok. I tried to do some performance numbers (code changes included in next patch) with about 2000 logs under archive path:
root@rain104bmc:~# ls /var/lib/phosphor-logging/extensions/pels/logs/archive/ | wc -l
2000
Jun 16 15:04:30 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[11118]: Duration to calculate size of archived files (in secs): 0.0432783
when we are tracking the PEL sizes, we use stat() to tell us how much space it takes up on disk.  So you can just use the getFileDiskSize() function from up above in this file.
Ok
yeah you are right I did it wrongly.
You may as well just combine this all into 1 string so that it's easy to read in the journal.
Ok
why did you change the loop here?
No particular reason thought it would be more readable. Yeah reverted to original.
I think you'll also have to support the list option, otherwise I'm not sure how anyone would know an archived PEL ID.  Then also update the --archive help text above.

List option ok.
Where to update --archive help text?

I was thinking maybe you can make _archiveSize a class member, and put this loop into the restore() function to get the current size of the archive on startup, and then have line 538 in the remove() function after you move the PEL into the archive. then it will be an up to date size, and then in this function you can just use _archiveSize in the check on 548
Yeah was thinking on similar lines where to put the _archiveSize that always get updated on startup. Will check this out.
Is it ok to initialise _archiveSize here?
you can do it in the hpp, like _lastPELID was.

I'm seeing size of archive folder increasing by 4K for every PEL deleted and moved to archive as follows. Is it expected?

Jun 17 14:18:26 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2430]: Created PEL 0x5000f663 (BMC ID 11) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 14:18:26 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2430]: Archive size: 12288
Jun 17 14:12:49 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2336]: Created PEL 0x5000f662 (BMC ID 11) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 14:12:49 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2336]: Archive size: 8192
Jun 17 11:22:56 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2178]: Created PEL 0x5000f661 (BMC ID 10) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 11:22:56 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2178]: Archive size: 8192
Jun 17 11:18:21 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2178]: Archive size: 8192
Jun 17 11:18:21 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2178]: Created PEL 0x5000f660 (BMC ID 9) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 11:16:08 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2125]: Created PEL 0x5000f65f (BMC ID 8) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 11:16:08 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2125]: Archive size: 8192
Jun 17 10:57:18 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2125]: Archive size: 4096
Jun 17 10:57:18 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2125]: Created PEL 0x5000f65e (BMC ID 7) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 10:54:37 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2125]: Created PEL 0x5000f65d (BMC ID 6) with SRC 110076F2
Jun 17 10:54:37 rain104bmc phosphor-log-manager[2125]: Archive size: 0
Yea, that's the block size on disk.
still need?
nope..will remove

also, I'd take a single comment that just says you're moving the file to the archive directory.
Done
How about an INFO trace here that says you are deleting the archived files

spelling.

nice testcase!
oh, sorry I missed this before.  can you change this to Deleted PELs?  deleted event logs (like in log_manager.cpp) aren't what is being moved.

how about just:
List or display archived PELs
yeah ok
if --archive is used, you don't need to display unarchived PELs.
basically never we would have a case to display all PELs incl. archive. If no archive flag, display regular PELs else with archive flag display only archived PELs
correct, we never need to show combined regular + archived.
you can remove this, since --archive was used.
Refer comment above
yeah right

Technically it isn't quite deleting a PEL that archives it, because peltool -d -and -D delete the files and doesn't don't an archive.

Maybe just call this section header:  PEL Archiving
Agree
how about:  When an OpenBMC event log is deleted ...
Ok
should probably put what path that is.
Ok
again probably better to specify:  PELs whose corresponding event logs have been deleted will be available..
Ok
maybe one more:  If a PEL is deleted using peltool it is not archived.
yeah good point.
sorry, just noticed this one - I don't think the archive check is needed here?
yeah archive would never be passed alone as its always going to be passed coupled with list or full PEL. Will remove the check.
will be available in a BMC dump
'an archive folder'.
in the archive folder.
can remove
all archived PELs
remove
